account_id_help: A service account enables your application or tool to connect securely to your resources. A user account enables users in your organization to access resources.
all_accounts_description: Uses a wildcard (*) to assign permissions to all user and service accounts
all_accounts_help: Review the list of existing permissions applied to all accounts within this Kafka instance.
assign_permissions_description: Assign permissions to the selected account ({{value}})

permissions_dropdown.shortcut_consume_topic_description: Provides access to consume from one or more topics depending on topic and consumer group selection criteria
permissions_dropdown.shortcut_manage_access_description: Provides access to add and remove permissions on this $t(common:kafka) instance
permissions_dropdown.shortcut_produce_topic_description: Provides access to produce to one or more topics depending on topic selection criteria

resource_prefix_rule.is_description: Refers to the literal name in the API
resource_prefix_rule.starts_with_description: Refers to the prefix of the name in the API

resourcePrefix.invalid_consumer_group: Valid characters in a consumer group ID include letters (Aaâ€“Zz), numbers, underscores ( _ ), and hyphens ( - ).
resourcePrefix.invalid_topic: Valid characters in a topic name include letters (Aa-Zz), numbers, underscores ( _ ), periods ( . ), and hyphens ( - ).
resourcePrefix.invalid_topic_name: A topic name must contain at least 3 periods (...) if periods are the only characters used.

selected_account_help: Review the list of existing permissions for the selected account. The list includes account-specific permissions and permissions applied to all accounts within this Kafka instance. Permissions labeled <1>All accounts</1> cannot be removed when an individual account ID is selected.
